title: No tsunami threats to Sri Lanka from Andaman Islands earthquake
snippet: An earthquake of magnitude 6.5 has struck off the Andaman Islands, an Indian archipelago in the Bay of Bengal, today (August 03). The tremor has occurred at around 9.12 am at a depth of about 95 km. Sri Lanka's National Early Tsunami Warning Centre of the Department of Meteorology assured that there is no threat of tsunami waves to the island at present due to the said earthquake.

title: The Rajapaksa Dynasty in Sri Lanka: Democracy in Decline
snippet: COVID-19, an economic crisis, and a majoritarian dynasty at the helm: Sri Lanka's future hangs in the balance. Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was swept into power with 6.9 million votes in November 2019 and subsequently saw his party's control bolstered with a two-thirds majority in Parliament in the general election of August 2020.
